intro: Diplusodon hatschbachii, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. It has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soil. Diplusodon hatschbachii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
